By day, the obelisk is a striking silhouette against the desert backdrop, a reminder of our unique place within time and space. As night falls, the installation glows from within, symbolizing enlightenment.

Marked by geometric harmony, it encourages one to consider their journey, to recognize their unique contributions to our collective story. It is a place to gather thoughts and to ground the self within the wide expanse of existence. We all live, and we all pass away. What is your purpose?

name: Tenseract
description: tensegrity + tesseract = tenseract

name: CAT/RAT MOBILITY CENTER
description: ANIMAL HOUSE RAT NEST CAT NEST DECO

name: As Above So Below
description:
As Above So Below

A sanctuary space aiding everyone in finding and growing the equanimity within each of us. 
With a nested space above and a womb room below this mini-temple provides both the openness for downloads and safety grounding. 
And if nothing else it's a beautiful place to escape the sometimes harsh elements of the playa while you pass through 9:00 & G.

name: The Exclamation Location!
description: The Exclamation Location! is a giant exclamation point on the playa. Here burners are encouraged to share their best Burning Man experiences with other burners in written and oral form. The best experiences of Burning Man's past, present, and possibly future will be told and recorded in the Book of Excitement.

name: Nang
description:
This deep playa chill space is 95% reused materials from past Burning Man events. At its core, the piece is an apologue. A story about transformation, redemption, and second chances. The material has a past: lumber retired from playa duty, supports a structure of about 700 bells made from spent high-pressure tanks, threaded on salvaged wire from earlier BM art. Beneath, fabric covered discarded mattresses—once bound for the landfill—offer one final gesture of comfort.

Like the people who encounter it, like these elements are not perfect or pristine, but made more meaningful by their history.
Wind stirs the bells into a constant din that challenges quiet—but invites a different kind of stillness: one found in letting go while staying present.

name: Experience True Level
description: Experience True Level is a minimalist installation featuring a precisely leveled 2x2 meter platform made of playa dust, raised slightly above the desert floor. Rendered perfectly flat with limited tools, the piece may subtly reference Rick and Morty's concept of a perfect plane. It reflects the human impulse to impose control on a chaotic environment. The flat platform symbolizes both our desire for order and the inevitability of entropy, echoing the tension between human constructs and the natural world. It stands as a quiet meditation on fragility and resilience.

name: Oh the Places You'll Go
description: Oh the Places You'll Go is a link between worlds, a portal between who one was, who one is, and who one can be. Two desks provide two different views and a chance to communicate to worlds and times beyond.

name: DeepPlayAShrineKosmicBusLens#25
description:
Welcome to the Kosmic Bus Stop.  

Service to the outer planets depends on Mental Attitude.   Service to other dimensions depends on the Alchemy.  Service to other realities depends on You.

travel safe and remember--You are the Alien.

AAAOOOOOOOHHHHHHMMMMMMMmmmmmmmmm

name: TRST Walking Broccoli
description: Describe what your project looks like and its meaning. Describe what your project looks like and its meaning. Describe what your project looks like and its meaning. Describe what your project looks like and its meaning. Describe what your project looks like and its meaning.

name: Campfire Nostalgia
description: Campfire Nostalgia is an immersive piece that explores the captivating interplay of light on metal. It displays a chandelier constructed from metal washers, each one catching and refracting light in ways that evoke the entrancing quality of a campfire's glow. This fascination with light's reflection off metal creates an experience reminiscent of staring endlessly into flames—alluring, yet deeply meditative. The piece encourages burners to stand around it, inviting them to leave behind digital distractions and rediscover the organic wonder of light and metal. The installation is both a homage to the primal allure of fire and a reminder of beauty found in simplicity amidst our technologically driven world.

name: WG Test Walk-In 2025
description: Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation Public Description of Installation

name: Fu,Lu,Shou,Xi,Cai
description:
Fu (Good Fortune), Lu (Prosperity), (Longevity), Xi (Happiness), and Cai (Wealth). Through dynamic presentation and interactive design, it explores the philosophical meanings of "Cultural Flow", "Quiet Power", and "Artistic Connection".

On-site, we will also teach Chinese blessing phrases and give away 1,000 miniature sculptures as cultural tokens, inviting audiences to become participants in a "blessing chain". These elements bridge linguistic and cultural barriers through emotional resonance, aligning with the Burning Man spirit of "Radical Inclusion" — connecting people through shared human experiences.

name: The Water Temple
description:
The Water Temple is a wave rising in the heart of the desert, as an artistic sanctuary and living altar, evoking water's ancient memory — and its message for today's world. 

Laser-cut metal panels are lit from the outside; inside, a centerpiece containing sacred world waters uses cymatics to project sound into shape, as frequency casts visible forms on temple walls. Indigenous prayers from the Brazilian Amazon,  whose traditions seeded this dream and blessed this project, are played as a promise to world waters — that we return to, protect and preserve our spiritual relationship to life-giving water. 

In remembrance, reverence, and reconnection, our mission grows together.

We belong. We are water. We are sacred.
artist: Douglas + Yaosca Jackson - Temple Pillars + Visionaries. Morten Ørtenblad, Design + Architecture

name: OVO Ignis
description: OVO Ignis ("Egg of Fire") is a 10-foot-tall, 12-foot-wide steel portal shaped with concentric rings and V shaped legs, symbolizing transformation. Forged from blackened steel—part shell, part skeleton—it holds a fire ceiling where flames dance above. Participants pass safely beneath controlled fire, invoking purification, surrender, and rebirth—or they just make out. The egg, reimagined as a crucible, becomes a threshold for burning away the old and stepping into the new—or simply a surreal, fiery experience to engage with.

name: Ghost Whale Shrine
description:
A bloom of jellyfish surrounds a whale marionette within a suspended house shaped structure which rises from a Mayan incense burner.

This installation merges myths with materials forged from renewal, sculpted from mycelium and recycled plastics - turning waste into form, honoring ancestors, and opening a space for reflection, reverence, and transformation across hidden dimensions of experience.

This piece represents the liminal space where whales and our imaginations inhabit.
A smoke offering from the Mayan culture to comfort and honour a ghost whale.
A reminder of the nature we have lost.

name: Clarisse McLellan Manual for Civilization
description:
A Fahrenheit 451 themed library/reading room at the Man Base (named after Clarisse McLellan from the book) made of the books you would want to restart a civilization, with an emphasis on banned books.
This piece is both reading room to save civilization, and a provocation to either save books or let them burn. All the books will have a book plate that explains that all are welcome to read the books during the week, but the day before the burn, they are asked to save any books they do not want to be burned. Any books left will be burned along with the Man.

name: Atlas
description:
About Atlas
Atlas is an interactive sculpture featuring a series of suspended moths inspired by endangered species in North America. Drawing visitors in with flowing light and harmonious sound, the sculpture responds to movement beneath it, creating a dynamic, immersive experience. Part of Jen Lewin's ongoing Moth Series, which began in 1999, Atlas celebrates the beauty and fragility of moths. Named after the Titan from Greek mythology who held up the sky, the work symbolizes the responsibility we share in protecting vulnerable species. By spotlighting these often-overlooked creatures, Atlas highlights the delicate balance of our ecosystems and encourages reflection on global ecological interdependence.

name: ARTerians Make Art - The AMA
description: The exhibit that is located in the ARTery focuses on the Arterians not only as support for artists on the playa but also as working artists.

name: Love and Light
description: Love and Light invites viewers to contemplate happiness, joy, beauty, light, positivity, the ability to embrace those traits in ourselves and others, and maybe even place themselves in the art.
